DataElement.preferredName: Bone Scan Medical Imaging Entire Skeletal System Assessment Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date on which the medical imaging assessment of the entire framework that supports the soft tissues of vertebrate animals and protects many of their internal organs to create images on a computer screen or on film was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Scan Medical Imaging Entire Skeletal System Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical imaging assessment of the enitre framework that supports the soft tissues of vertebrate animals and protects many of their internal organs to create images on a computer screen or on film.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique to create images of bones on a computer screen or on film. A small amount of radioactive material is injected into a blood vessel and travels through the bloodstream; it collects in the bones and is detected by a scanner.:In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.

Concepts.definition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.
In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:The framework that supports the soft tissues of vertebrate animals and protects many of their internal organs.  The skeletons of vertebrates are made of bone and/or cartilage.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.

The collection of bones and tissues, including ligaments and cartilage, that compose the rigid internal framework of the human body, and which serves a multitude of functions, including structural support, movement, protection, production of blood cells, storage of ions, and endocrine regulation.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
